ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Bye everyone!
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks! I ve been lucky in that the few groups that I do moderate I haven t had to do anything more than occassionally post a calender reminder of someone s
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks!
I've been lucky in that the few groups that I do moderate I haven't had to
do anything more than occassionally post a calender reminder of someone's
birthday except for one case where I had someone unreasonable who had a
problem with the word "fruck" and left the list bc they felt I should ban
the use of the made up word. I want the list to be friendly and fun.
I won't make any new rules or anything unless things go sour and I have to.
Hopefully things will stay as they are.
luv,
-Su

Rock on SU........ Nice job.

I am not sure how the board has always been but I personally think it should
be moderated too. Just to keep spammers, Off-topic, and unnecessary
vulagarities off this list. I have not seen this group abused like others I
am on, WOW, but I think moderation keeps people longer.

Just my 2 cents.

Rob
----- Original Message -----
From: Dunbar Keglifter
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, March 23, 2002 5:08 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] Bye everyone!



Hi!

As a result of me quitting EQ I have handed over the ownership of this
mailing list to Su, she seems like a reasonable person to carry on, even
tho there isn't really much this list has required in the ways of
maintenance.. I have barely done jack here since I started it back
during beta.. :p However i did restrict access to the calendar now and
removed that annoying spam event thing hehe...

Good luck everyone!

- Dunbar / Avron
